text: Nótt (Old Norse "night") is a personification of the night in the Norse mythology. A goddess similar to her, but in Greek mythology, is Nyx. Nótt is called "night" by mankind, "darkness" by the gods, "unlight" by jötnar, "joy- of-sleep" by the elves. Nótt is usually represented by an Owl and revolves around her son, Dagr. She is know as black and swarthy, a daughter of the giant Narfi and granddaughter of the Norse god, Loki. She had three husbands: *Naglfari *Annar *Dellingr She has three children: *Auðr *Jörð *Dagr Her horse is Hrímfaxi. Category:Norse mythology
title: Nótt
